summary: This document is a chain of emails from October-November 2020 between Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey and defense attorney Glen McGorty, coordinating a second proffer interview via WebEx with an unnamed individual (referred to as 'Mr. [Redacted]'). The interview is intended to cover the individual's interactions with a U.S. Customs and Border Protection employee in Saint Thomas and any interactions with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Glen McGorty
persons.context: Managing Partner at Crowell & Moring LLP, representing an unnamed client ('Mr. [Redacted]') in communications with the U.S. Attorney's Office to schedule a proffer interview.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Prosecutor with the Southern District of New York leading the investigation, coordinating with defense counsel to schedule and outline topics for a proffer interview with an unnamed individual.

persons.name: Daniel Zelenko
persons.context: Copied on the email chain, appears to be part of the legal team involved in the case.

persons.name: Danielle Giffuni
persons.context: Copied on the email chain, appears to be part of the legal team involved in the case.

persons.name: Josh Morrissey
persons.context: IT group member at Crowell & Moring LLP added to ensure technical readiness for the WebEx meeting.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as a subject of inquiry; the proffer interview aims to ask about any interactions the unnamed individual may have had with Epstein.

connections.description: Prosecutor and defense attorney communicating to schedule and prepare for a proffer interview of McGorty's client.
Both appear to be attorneys copied on the same legal correspondence, likely part of the same defense team.
Both appear to be attorneys copied on the same legal correspondence, likely part of the same defense team.
McGorty requests Morrissey from the IT group to ensure technical setup for a legal meeting.
Comey, as a prosecutor, is investigating matters related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Interview
events.description: A second proffer interview scheduled via WebEx between the U.S. Attorney's Office and an unnamed individual represented by Glen McGorty.

events.title: First Proffer Interview
events.description: Reference to a prior, longer proffer interview between the parties.

events.title: Proffer Agreement Signed
events.description: Glen McGorty sends the signed proffer agreement to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was conducting a proffer interview in November 2020 with an unnamed individual to inquire about that person's interactions with a U.S. Customs and Border Protection employee based in Saint Thomas.
The investigation sought information about any interactions the unnamed individual may have had with Jeffrey Epstein.
The correspondence highlights ongoing investigative work by the SDNY related to the Epstein case well after Epstein's death in 2019.
A key line of inquiry involved an unnamed CBP employee who had the unnamed individual listed as a contact in their phone.
